intro: Aquilegia ophiolithica, commonly known as the alpine cress, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, spurred petals and delicate foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pink or red, and it produces small, yellowish fruits that contain the seeds. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
